p: Equine encephalosis virus (EEV) is an orbivirus close to African horse sickness and bluetongue viruses, two arboviruses associated with unexpected emergence in Europe in 1989 and 2006 respectively [ 178, 179]. It is a primary endotheliotropic virus and most EEV infection cases are asymptomatic or poorly symptomatic, but its clinical presentation may include ataxia, depression, hyper excitability and convulsions. Since its description in Israel in 2008â€“2009, it is of primary importance to improve the preparedness of European countries to EEV emergence [ 180].
